review: Very Disappointed in the Fire Stick. Replaced by Amazon but never worked.  I spoke with Customer Service on four different occasions and they were unable to resolve the issues.  The Fire Stick is so slow that the network "times out" and the connection is lost.  The first Fire Stick never got past the "looking for updates" step.  The second (replacement) Fire Stick did load the updates, but could never get past the Home Page.  Every time I would navigate to browse content the connection was lost.  I had the Amazon Fire App on my Android, and while it was able to connect to my Fire Stick, only the "Home" and "Back" commands worked.  I was unable to use the keypad to sign in to my Netflix account because the "Connection Lost" error just kept coming up.  I talked to my Internet provider and there was no router restrictions on the number of devices it was supporting or the bandwidth.  I have never had Internet connection problems on my other devices, including streaming content to my PC or to my Kindle Fire.I ended up returning the Fire Stick to Amazon for a refund.
author: D. Kiker "DK"

review: I like everything about it except movies buffer like crazy.Edit:  I was having trouble with my wifi dropping out.  I did some research and this solved the problem:Go to your router settings and select a channel other than the default "auto".  So many people use the same channels that apparently there is interference.I did this and it worked!
